required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Safety and Pharmacokinetics of Single Doses of ASP2151 in Healthy Male Subjects and the Effects of Food
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Single Dose Escalating Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of ASP2151 in Healthy Male Subjects, Followed by an Open, Two-Period Crossover Study to Assess the Effect of Fed Conditions on the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of ASP2151

brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of single rising doses of ASP2151 under fasted condition in healthy male subjects.
The study will also evaluate the pharmacokinetics (PK) of a single dose of ASP2151 under fasted versus fed conditions in healthy male subjects.

detailed_description.textblock:
Study will be divided into two parts. Part 1 will evaluate the safety and tolerability of ASP2151 single rising doses in groups A-H in fasted condition and to determine the maximum tolerable dose (MTD) if possible.
Part 2 will evaluate the effect of fasted versus fed conditions on the safety, tolerability and PK of a single dose of ASP2151 in two treatment cycles. The wash-out period between the two treatment cycles will be at least 5 days and not shorter than five times the average elimination half-life of ASP2151, as determined in part 1 of the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability assessed by nature, frequency, and severity of Adverse Events (AEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 15 of each treatment period
Up to Day 15 of each treatment period

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by vital sign measurement: blood pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 15 of each treatment period
primary_outcome.description: For Part 1 and Part 2 includes systolic and blood diastolic pressure

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by vital sign measurement: pulse rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 15 of each treatment period

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 15 of each treatment period

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 15 of each treatment period

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by laboratory test: serology
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 15 of each treatment period

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by laboratory test: urinalysis
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 15 of each treatment period

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by physical exam: body weight
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 15 of each treatment period

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by physical exam: height
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 15 of each treatment period

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by physical exam: body mass index (BMI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ASP2151 in plasma: AUC0-inf
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours in each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: For Part 1 and 2. AUC0-inf: Area under the concentration time curve from the time of dosing extrapolated to time infinity

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ASP2151 in plasma: t1/2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours in each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: For Part 1 and 2. t1/2: Apparent terminal elimination half-life

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ASP2151 in plasma: Cmax
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours in each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: For Part 1 and 2. Cmax: Maximum concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ASP2151 in plasma: tmax
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours in each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: For Part 1 and 2. tmax: The time after dosing when Cmax occurs

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ASP2151 in plasma: CL/F
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours in each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: For Part 1 and 2. CL/F: Oral clearance

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ASP2151 in plasma: Vz/F
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours in each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: For Part 1 and 2. Vz/F: Apparent volume of distribution

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ASP2151 in plasma: AUClast
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours in each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: For Part 1 and 2. AUClast: Area under the plasma concentration time curve from time of dosing up to the last quantifiable sample

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ASP2151 in plasma: tlag
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours in each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: For Part 1 and 2. tlag: Absorption lag time

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ASP2151 in urine: Aelast
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours in each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: For Part 1 and 2. Aelast: Amount excreted unchanged in urine from time of dosing up to the last quantifiable sample

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ASP2151 in urine: Ae0-inf
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours in each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: For Part 1 and 2. Ae0-inf: Amount excreted unchanged in urine from time of dosing extrapolated to infinity

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ASP2151 in urine: Ae%
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours in each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: For Part 1 and 2. Ae%: Percent of ASP2151 amount excreted in urine

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of ASP2151 in urine: CLr
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours in each treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: For Part 1 and 2. CLr: Renal clearance

Participants will receive single dose of matching placebo on day 1

Participants will receive a single dose of ASP2151 under fasted conditions on day 1 in the first treatment period (period 1). Following a wash-out period of at least five days, the treatment will be repeated in the reverse orientation (period 2)

Participants will receive a single dose of ASP2151 under fed conditions on day 1 in the first treatment period (period 1). Following a wash-out period of at least five days, the treatment will be repeated in the reverse orientation (period 2)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body weight between 60 and 100 kg, and BMI between 18 and 30 kg/m2 inclusive
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known or suspected hypersensitivity to ASP2151 or any components of the formulation used
- Any clinically significant history of asthma, eczema, any other allergic condition or previous severe hypersensitivity to any drug
- Any clinically significant history of genital herpes symptoms and/or herpes zoster symptoms in the 3 months prior to admission to the Clinical Unit
- Any clinically significant history of any other disease or disorder - gastrointestinal, cardiovascular, respiratory, renal, hepatic, neurological, dermatological, psychiatric or metabolic
- Abnormal pulse rate and/or blood pressure measurements at the pre-study visit as follows: Pulse rate <40 or >90 bpm (beats per minute); mean systolic blood pressure <90 or >140 mmHg (millimeter of mercury); mean diastolic blood pressure <40 or >95 mmHg
- Regular use of any prescribed or OTC (over the counter) drugs in the 4 weeks prior to admission to the Clinical Unit OR any use of such drugs in the 2 weeks prior to admission to the Clinical Unit
- Any use of drugs of abuse within 3 months prior to admission to the Clinical Unit
- History of smoking more than 10 cigarettes per day within 3 months prior to admission to the Clinical Unit
- History of drinking more than 21 units of alcohol per week within 3 months prior to admission to the Clinical Unit
- Donation of blood or blood products within 3 months, prior to admission to the Clinical Unit
- Positive serology test for HBsAg (Hepatitis B surface antigen), HAV IgM (Hepatitis A Virus), anti-HCV (Hepatitis C Virus) or anti-HIV (Human Immunodeficiency Virus) 1 and 2
- Not willing or able to swallow size 00 capsules

overall_official.affiliation: Astellas Pharma Clinical Pharmacology & Exploratory Dev.
